Browse the source code of netbsd/external/bsd/ntp/dist/ntpdate/ntpdate.c

1/* $NetBSD: ntpdate.c,v 1.13 2018/12/26 18:31:29 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*
4 * ntpdate - set the time of day by polling one or more NTP servers
5 */
6
7#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
8# include <config.h>
9#endif

11#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
12#include <netinfo/ni.h>
13#endif

16#include "ntp_fp.h"

58/* select wants a zero structure ... */
59struct timeval timeout = {0,0};
60#elif defined(SYS_WINNT)
61/*
62 * Windows does not abort a select select call if SIGALRM goes off
63 * so a 200 ms timeout is needed (TIMER_HZ is 5).
64 */
65struct sock_timeval timeout = {0,1000000/TIMER_HZ};
66#else
67struct timeval timeout = {60,0};
68#endif
69
70#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
71#include <netinfo/ni.h>
72#endif

74#include "recvbuff.h"

77#define TARGET_RESOLUTION 1 /* Try for 1-millisecond accuracy
78 on Windows NT timers. */
79#pragma comment(lib, "winmm")
80isc_boolean_t ntp_port_inuse(int af, u_short port);
81UINT wTimerRes;
82#endif /* SYS_WINNT */

84/*
85 * Scheduling priority we run at
86 */
87#ifndef SYS_VXWORKS
88# define NTPDATE_PRIO (-12)
89#else
90# define NTPDATE_PRIO (100)
91#endif
92
93#ifdef HAVE_TIMER_CREATE
94/* POSIX TIMERS - vxWorks doesn't have itimer - casey */
95static timer_t ntpdate_timerid;
96#endif
97
98/*
99 * Compatibility stuff for Version 2
100 */
101#define NTP_MAXSKW 0x28f /* 0.01 sec in fp format */
102#define NTP_MINDIST 0x51f /* 0.02 sec in fp format */
103#define PEER_MAXDISP (64*FP_SECOND) /* maximum dispersion (fp 64) */
104#define NTP_INFIN 15 /* max stratum, infinity a la Bellman-Ford */
105#define NTP_MAXWGT (8*FP_SECOND) /* maximum select weight 8 seconds */
106#define NTP_MAXLIST 5 /* maximum select list size */
107#define PEER_SHIFT 8 /* 8 suitable for crystal time base */
108
109/*
110 * for get_systime()
111 */
112s_char sys_precision; /* local clock precision (log2 s) */
113
114/*
115 * File descriptor masks etc. for call to select
116 */
117
118int ai_fam_templ;
119int nbsock; /* the number of sockets used */
120SOCKET fd[MAX_AF];
121int fd_family[MAX_AF]; /* to remember the socket family */
122#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
123struct pollfd fdmask[MAX_AF];
124#else
125fd_set fdmask;
126SOCKET maxfd;
127#endif
128int polltest = 0;
129
130/*
131 * Initializing flag. All async routines watch this and only do their
132 * thing when it is clear.
133 */
134int initializing = 1;
135
136/*
137 * Alarm flag. Set when an alarm occurs
138 */
139volatile int alarm_flag = 0;
140
141/*
142 * Simple query flag.
143 */
144int simple_query = 0;
145
146/*
147 * Unprivileged port flag.
148 */
149int unpriv_port = 0;
150
151/*
152 * Program name.
153 */
154char const *progname;
155
156/*
157 * Systemwide parameters and flags
158 */
159int sys_samples = 0; /* number of samples/server, will be modified later */
160u_long sys_timeout = DEFTIMEOUT; /* timeout time, in TIMER_HZ units */
161struct server *sys_servers; /* the server list */
162int sys_numservers = 0; /* number of servers to poll */
163int sys_authenticate = 0; /* true when authenticating */
164u_int32 sys_authkey = 0; /* set to authentication key in use */
165u_long sys_authdelay = 0; /* authentication delay */
166int sys_version = NTP_VERSION; /* version to poll with */
167
168/*
169 * The current internal time
170 */
171u_long current_time = 0;
172
173/*
174 * Counter for keeping track of completed servers
175 */
176int complete_servers = 0;
177
178/*
179 * File of encryption keys
180 */
181
182#ifndef KEYFILE
183# ifndef SYS_WINNT
184#define KEYFILE "/etc/ntp.keys"
185# else
186#define KEYFILE "%windir%\\ntp.keys"
187# endif /* SYS_WINNT */
188#endif /* KEYFILE */
189
190#ifndef SYS_WINNT
191const char *key_file = KEYFILE;
192#else
193char key_file_storage[MAX_PATH+1], *key_file ;
194#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
195
196/*
197 * Miscellaneous flags
198 */
199int verbose = 0;
200int always_step = 0;
201int never_step = 0;
202
203int ntpdatemain (int, char **);
204
205static void transmit (struct server *);
206static void receive (struct recvbuf *);
207static void server_data (struct server *, s_fp, l_fp *, u_fp);
208static void clock_filter (struct server *);
209static struct server *clock_select (void);
210static int clock_adjust (void);
211static void addserver (char *);
212static struct server *findserver (sockaddr_u *);
213 void timer (void);
214static void init_alarm (void);
215#ifndef SYS_WINNT
216static RETSIGTYPE alarming (int);
217#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
218static void init_io (void);
219static void sendpkt (sockaddr_u *, struct pkt *, int);
220void input_handler (void);
221
222static int l_adj_systime (l_fp *);
223static int l_step_systime (l_fp *);
224
225static void print_server (struct server *, FILE *);
226

228int on = 1;
229WORD wVersionRequested;
230WSADATA wsaData;
231#endif /* SYS_WINNT */

233#ifdef NO_MAIN_ALLOWED
234CALL(ntpdate,"ntpdate",ntpdatemain);
235
236void clear_globals()
237{
238 /*
239 * Debugging flag
240 */
241 debug = 0;
242
243 ntp_optind = 0;
244 /*
245 * Initializing flag. All async routines watch this and only do their
246 * thing when it is clear.
247 */
248 initializing = 1;
249
250 /*
251 * Alarm flag. Set when an alarm occurs
252 */
253 alarm_flag = 0;
254
255 /*
256 * Simple query flag.
257 */
258 simple_query = 0;
259
260 /*
261 * Unprivileged port flag.
262 */
263 unpriv_port = 0;
264
265 /*
266 * Systemwide parameters and flags
267 */
268 sys_numservers = 0; /* number of servers to poll */
269 sys_authenticate = 0; /* true when authenticating */
270 sys_authkey = 0; /* set to authentication key in use */
271 sys_authdelay = 0; /* authentication delay */
272 sys_version = NTP_VERSION; /* version to poll with */
273
274 /*
275 * The current internal time
276 */
277 current_time = 0;
278
279 /*
280 * Counter for keeping track of completed servers
281 */
282 complete_servers = 0;
283 verbose = 0;
284 always_step = 0;
285 never_step = 0;
286}
287#endif
288
289#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
290static ni_namelist *getnetinfoservers (void);
291#endif
292
293/*
294 * Main program. Initialize us and loop waiting for I/O and/or
295 * timer expiries.
296 */
297#ifndef NO_MAIN_ALLOWED
298int
299main(
300 int argc,
301 char *argv[]
302 )
303{
304 return ntpdatemain (argc, argv);
305}
306#endif /* NO_MAIN_ALLOWED */
307
308int
309ntpdatemain (
310 int argc,
311 char *argv[]
312 )
313{
314 int was_alarmed;
315 int tot_recvbufs;
316 struct recvbuf *rbuf;
317 l_fp tmp;
318 int errflg;
319 int c;
320 int nfound;
321
322#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
323 ni_namelist *netinfoservers;
324#endif
325#ifdef SYS_WINNT
326 key_file = key_file_storage;
327
328 if (!ExpandEnvironmentStrings(KEYFILE, key_file, MAX_PATH))
329 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "ExpandEnvironmentStrings(KEYFILE) failed: %m");
330
331 ssl_applink();
332#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
333
334#ifdef NO_MAIN_ALLOWED
335 clear_globals();
336#endif
337
338 init_lib(); /* sets up ipv4_works, ipv6_works */
339
340 /* Check to see if we have IPv6. Otherwise default to IPv4 */
341 if (!ipv6_works)
342 ai_fam_templ = AF_INET;
343
344 errflg = 0;
345 progname = argv[0];
346 syslogit = 0;
347
348 /*
349 * Decode argument list
350 */
351 while ((c = ntp_getopt(argc, argv, "46a:bBde:k:o:p:qst:uv")) != EOF)
352 switch (c)
353 {
354 case '4':
355 ai_fam_templ = AF_INET;
356 break;
357 case '6':
358 ai_fam_templ = AF_INET6;
359 break;
360 case 'a':
361 c = atoi(ntp_optarg);
362 sys_authenticate = 1;
363 sys_authkey = c;
364 break;
365 case 'b':
366 always_step++;
367 never_step = 0;
368 break;
369 case 'B':
370 never_step++;
371 always_step = 0;
372 break;
373 case 'd':
374 ++debug;
375 break;
376 case 'e':
377 if (!atolfp(ntp_optarg, &tmp)
378 || tmp.l_ui != 0) {
379 (void) fprintf(stderr,
380 "%s: encryption delay %s is unlikely\n",
381 progname, ntp_optarg);
382 errflg++;
383 } else {
384 sys_authdelay = tmp.l_uf;
385 }
386 break;
387 case 'k':
388 key_file = ntp_optarg;
389 break;
390 case 'o':
391 sys_version = atoi(ntp_optarg);
392 break;
393 case 'p':
394 c = atoi(ntp_optarg);
395 if (c <= 0 || c > NTP_SHIFT) {
396 (void) fprintf(stderr,
397 "%s: number of samples (%d) is invalid\n",
398 progname, c);
399 errflg++;
400 } else {
401 sys_samples = c;
402 }
403 break;
404 case 'q':
405 simple_query = 1;
406 break;
407 case 's':
408 syslogit = 1;
409 break;
410 case 't':
411 if (!atolfp(ntp_optarg, &tmp)) {
412 (void) fprintf(stderr,
413 "%s: timeout %s is undecodeable\n",
414 progname, ntp_optarg);
415 errflg++;
416 } else {
417 sys_timeout = ((LFPTOFP(&tmp) * TIMER_HZ)
418 + 0x8000) >> 16;
419 sys_timeout = max(sys_timeout, MINTIMEOUT);
420 }
421 break;
422 case 'v':
423 verbose = 1;
424 break;
425 case 'u':
426 unpriv_port = 1;
427 break;
428 case '?':
429 ++errflg;
430 break;
431 default:
432 break;
433 }
434
435 if (errflg) {
436usage:
437 (void) fprintf(stderr,
438 "usage: %s [-46bBdqsuv] [-a key#] [-e delay] [-k file] [-p samples] [-o version#] [-t timeo] server ...\n",
439 progname);
440 exit(2);
441 }
442
443 /*
444 * If number of Samples (-p) not specified by user:
445 * - if a simple_query (-q) just ONE will do
446 * - otherwise the normal is DEFSAMPLES
447 */
448 if (sys_samples == 0)
449 sys_samples = (simple_query ? 1 : DEFSAMPLES);
450
451 if (debug || simple_query) {
452#ifdef HAVE_SETVBUF
453 static char buf[BUFSIZ];
454 setvbuf(stdout, buf, _IOLBF, BUFSIZ);
455#else
456 setlinebuf(stdout);
457#endif
458 }
459
460 /*
461 * Logging. Open the syslog if we have to
462 */
463 if (syslogit) {
464#if !defined (SYS_WINNT) && !defined (SYS_VXWORKS) && !defined SYS_CYGWIN32
465# ifndef LOG_DAEMON
466 openlog("ntpdate", LOG_PID);
467# else
468
469# ifndef LOG_NTP
470# define LOG_NTP LOG_DAEMON
471# endif
472 openlog("ntpdate", LOG_PID | LOG_NDELAY, LOG_NTP);
473 if (debug)
474 setlogmask(LOG_UPTO(LOG_DEBUG));
475 else
476 setlogmask(LOG_UPTO(LOG_INFO));
477# endif /* LOG_DAEMON */
478#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
479 }
480
481 if (debug || verbose)
482 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "%s", Version);
483
484 /*
485 * Add servers we are going to be polling
486 */
487#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
488 netinfoservers = getnetinfoservers();
489#endif
490
491 for ( ; ntp_optind < argc; ntp_optind++)
492 addserver(argv[ntp_optind]);
493
494#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
495 if (netinfoservers) {
496 if ( netinfoservers->ni_namelist_len &&
497 *netinfoservers->ni_namelist_val ) {
498 u_int servercount = 0;
499 while (servercount < netinfoservers->ni_namelist_len) {
500 if (debug) msyslog(LOG_DEBUG,
501 "Adding time server %s from NetInfo configuration.",
502 netinfoservers->ni_namelist_val[servercount]);
503 addserver(netinfoservers->ni_namelist_val[servercount++]);
504 }
505 }
506 ni_namelist_free(netinfoservers);
507 free(netinfoservers);
508 }
509#endif
510
511 if (sys_numservers == 0) {
512 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "no servers can be used, exiting");
513 goto usage;
514 }
515
516 /*
517 * Initialize the time of day routines and the I/O subsystem
518 */
519 if (sys_authenticate) {
520 init_auth();
521 if (!authreadkeys(key_file)) {
522 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "no key file <%s>, exiting", key_file);
523 exit(1);
524 }
525 authtrust(sys_authkey, 1);
526 if (!authistrusted(sys_authkey)) {
527 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "authentication key %lu unknown",
528 (unsigned long) sys_authkey);
529 exit(1);
530 }
531 }
532 init_io();
533 init_alarm();
534
535 /*
536 * Set the priority.
537 */
538#ifdef SYS_VXWORKS
539 taskPrioritySet( taskIdSelf(), NTPDATE_PRIO);
540#endif
541#if defined(HAVE_ATT_NICE)
542 nice (NTPDATE_PRIO);
543#endif
544#if defined(HAVE_BSD_NICE)
545 (void) setpriority(PRIO_PROCESS, 0, NTPDATE_PRIO);
546#endif
547
548
549 initializing = 0;
550 was_alarmed = 0;
551
552 while (complete_servers < sys_numservers) {
553#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
554 struct pollfd* rdfdes;
555 rdfdes = fdmask;
556#else
557 fd_set rdfdes;
558 rdfdes = fdmask;
559#endif
560
561 if (alarm_flag) { /* alarmed? */
562 was_alarmed = 1;
563 alarm_flag = 0;
564 }
565 tot_recvbufs = full_recvbuffs(); /* get received buffers */
566
567 if (!was_alarmed && tot_recvbufs == 0) {
568 /*
569 * Nothing to do. Wait for something.
570 */
571#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
572 nfound = poll(rdfdes, (unsigned int)nbsock, timeout.tv_sec * 1000);
573
574#else
575 nfound = select(maxfd, &rdfdes, NULL, NULL,
576 &timeout);
577#endif
578 if (nfound > 0)
579 input_handler();
580 else if (nfound == SOCKET_ERROR)
581 {
582#ifndef SYS_WINNT
583 if (errno != EINTR)
584#else
585 if (WSAGetLastError() != WSAEINTR)
586#endif
587 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
588#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
589 "poll() error: %m"
590#else
591 "select() error: %m"
592#endif
593 );
594 } else if (errno != 0) {
595#ifndef SYS_VXWORKS
596 msyslog(LOG_DEBUG,
597#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
598 "poll(): nfound = %d, error: %m",
599#else
600 "select(): nfound = %d, error: %m",
601#endif
602 nfound);
603#endif
604 }
605 if (alarm_flag) { /* alarmed? */
606 was_alarmed = 1;
607 alarm_flag = 0;
608 }
609 tot_recvbufs = full_recvbuffs(); /* get received buffers */
610 }
611
612 /*
613 * Out here, signals are unblocked. Call receive
614 * procedure for each incoming packet.
615 */
616 rbuf = get_full_recv_buffer();
617 while (rbuf != NULL)
618 {
619 receive(rbuf);
620 freerecvbuf(rbuf);
621 rbuf = get_full_recv_buffer();
622 }
623
624 /*
625 * Call timer to process any timeouts
626 */
627 if (was_alarmed) {
628 timer();
629 was_alarmed = 0;
630 }
631
632 /*
633 * Go around again
634 */
635 }
636
637 /*
638 * When we get here we've completed the polling of all servers.
639 * Adjust the clock, then exit.
640 */
641#ifdef SYS_WINNT
642 WSACleanup();
643#endif
644#ifdef SYS_VXWORKS
645 close (fd);
646 timer_delete(ntpdate_timerid);
647#endif
648
649 return clock_adjust();
650}
651
652
653/*
654 * transmit - transmit a packet to the given server, or mark it completed.
655 * This is called by the timeout routine and by the receive
656 * procedure.
657 */
658static void
659transmit(
660 register struct server *server
661 )
662{
663 struct pkt xpkt;
664
665 if (server->filter_nextpt < server->xmtcnt) {
666 l_fp ts;
667 /*
668 * Last message to this server timed out. Shift
669 * zeros into the filter.
670 */
671 L_CLR(&ts);
672 server_data(server, 0, &ts, 0);
673 }
674
675 if ((int)server->filter_nextpt >= sys_samples) {
676 /*
677 * Got all the data we need. Mark this guy
678 * completed and return.
679 */
680 server->event_time = 0;
681 complete_servers++;
682 return;
683 }
684
685 if (debug)
686 printf("transmit(%s)\n", stoa(&server->srcadr));
687
688 /*
689 * If we're here, send another message to the server. Fill in
690 * the packet and let 'er rip.
691 */
692 xpkt.li_vn_mode = PKT_LI_VN_MODE(LEAP_NOTINSYNC,
693 sys_version, MODE_CLIENT);
694 xpkt.stratum = STRATUM_TO_PKT(STRATUM_UNSPEC);
695 xpkt.ppoll = NTP_MINPOLL;
696 xpkt.precision = NTPDATE_PRECISION;
697 xpkt.rootdelay = htonl(NTPDATE_DISTANCE);
698 xpkt.rootdisp = htonl(NTPDATE_DISP);
699 xpkt.refid = htonl(NTPDATE_REFID);
700 L_CLR(&xpkt.reftime);
701 L_CLR(&xpkt.org);
702 L_CLR(&xpkt.rec);
703
704 /*
705 * Determine whether to authenticate or not. If so,
706 * fill in the extended part of the packet and do it.
707 * If not, just timestamp it and send it away.
708 */
709 if (sys_authenticate) {
710 size_t len;
711
712 xpkt.exten[0] = htonl(sys_authkey);
713 get_systime(&server->xmt);
714 L_ADDUF(&server->xmt, sys_authdelay);
715 HTONL_FP(&server->xmt, &xpkt.xmt);
716 len = authencrypt(sys_authkey, (u_int32 *)&xpkt, LEN_PKT_NOMAC);
717 sendpkt(&server->srcadr, &xpkt, (int)(LEN_PKT_NOMAC + len));
718
719 if (debug > 1)
720 printf("transmit auth to %s\n",
721 stoa(&server->srcadr));
722 } else {
723 get_systime(&(server->xmt));
724 HTONL_FP(&server->xmt, &xpkt.xmt);
725 sendpkt(&server->srcadr, &xpkt, LEN_PKT_NOMAC);
726
727 if (debug > 1)
728 printf("transmit to %s\n", stoa(&server->srcadr));
729 }
730
731 /*
732 * Update the server timeout and transmit count
733 */
734 server->event_time = current_time + sys_timeout;
735 server->xmtcnt++;
736}
737
738
739/*
740 * receive - receive and process an incoming frame
741 */
742static void
743receive(
744 struct recvbuf *rbufp
745 )
746{
747 register struct pkt *rpkt;
748 register struct server *server;
749 register s_fp di;
750 l_fp t10, t23, tmp;
751 l_fp org;
752 l_fp rec;
753 l_fp ci;
754 int has_mac;
755 int is_authentic;
756
757 if (debug)
758 printf("receive(%s)\n", stoa(&rbufp->recv_srcadr));
759 /*
760 * Check to see if the packet basically looks like something
761 * intended for us.
762 */
763 if (rbufp->recv_length == LEN_PKT_NOMAC)
764 has_mac = 0;
765 else if (rbufp->recv_length >= (int)LEN_PKT_NOMAC)
766 has_mac = 1;
767 else {
768 if (debug)
769 printf("receive: packet length %d\n",
770 rbufp->recv_length);
771 return; /* funny length packet */
772 }
773
774 rpkt = &(rbufp->recv_pkt);
775 if (PKT_VERSION(rpkt->li_vn_mode) < NTP_OLDVERSION ||
776 PKT_VERSION(rpkt->li_vn_mode) > NTP_VERSION) {
777 return;
778 }
779
780 if ((PKT_MODE(rpkt->li_vn_mode) != MODE_SERVER
781 && PKT_MODE(rpkt->li_vn_mode) != MODE_PASSIVE)
782 || rpkt->stratum >= STRATUM_UNSPEC) {
783 if (debug)
784 printf("receive: mode %d stratum %d\n",
785 PKT_MODE(rpkt->li_vn_mode), rpkt->stratum);
786 return;
787 }
788
789 /*
790 * So far, so good. See if this is from a server we know.
791 */
792 server = findserver(&(rbufp->recv_srcadr));
793 if (server == NULL) {
794 if (debug)
795 printf("receive: server not found\n");
796 return;
797 }
798
799 /*
800 * Decode the org timestamp and make sure we're getting a response
801 * to our last request.
802 */
803 NTOHL_FP(&rpkt->org, &org);
804 if (!L_ISEQU(&org, &server->xmt)) {
805 if (debug)
806 printf("receive: pkt.org and peer.xmt differ\n");
807 return;
808 }
809
810 /*
811 * Check out the authenticity if we're doing that.
812 */
813 if (!sys_authenticate)
814 is_authentic = 1;
815 else {
816 is_authentic = 0;
817
818 if (debug > 3)
819 printf("receive: rpkt keyid=%ld sys_authkey=%ld decrypt=%ld\n",
820 (long int)ntohl(rpkt->exten[0]), (long int)sys_authkey,
821 (long int)authdecrypt(sys_authkey, (u_int32 *)rpkt,
822 LEN_PKT_NOMAC, (size_t)(rbufp->recv_length - LEN_PKT_NOMAC)));
823
824 if (has_mac && ntohl(rpkt->exten[0]) == sys_authkey &&
825 authdecrypt(sys_authkey, (u_int32 *)rpkt, LEN_PKT_NOMAC,
826 (size_t)(rbufp->recv_length - LEN_PKT_NOMAC)))
827 is_authentic = 1;
828 if (debug)
829 printf("receive: authentication %s\n",
830 is_authentic ? "passed" : "failed");
831 }
832 server->trust <<= 1;
833 if (!is_authentic)
834 server->trust |= 1;
835
836 /*
837 * Check for a KoD (rate limiting) response, cease and decist.
838 */
839 if (LEAP_NOTINSYNC == PKT_LEAP(rpkt->li_vn_mode) &&
840 STRATUM_PKT_UNSPEC == rpkt->stratum &&
841 !memcmp("RATE", &rpkt->refid, 4)) {
842 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "%s rate limit response from server.",
843 stoa(&rbufp->recv_srcadr));
844 server->event_time = 0;
845 complete_servers++;
846 return;
847 }
848
849 /*
850 * Looks good. Record info from the packet.
851 */
852 server->leap = PKT_LEAP(rpkt->li_vn_mode);
853 server->stratum = PKT_TO_STRATUM(rpkt->stratum);
854 server->precision = rpkt->precision;
855 server->rootdelay = ntohl(rpkt->rootdelay);
856 server->rootdisp = ntohl(rpkt->rootdisp);
857 server->refid = rpkt->refid;
858 NTOHL_FP(&rpkt->reftime, &server->reftime);
859 NTOHL_FP(&rpkt->rec, &rec);
860 NTOHL_FP(&rpkt->xmt, &server->org);
861
862 /*
863 * Make sure the server is at least somewhat sane. If not, try
864 * again.
865 */
866 if (L_ISZERO(&rec) || !L_ISHIS(&server->org, &rec)) {
867 server->event_time = current_time + sys_timeout;
868 return;
869 }
870
871 /*
872 * Calculate the round trip delay (di) and the clock offset (ci).
873 * We use the equations (reordered from those in the spec):
874 *
875 * d = (t2 - t3) - (t1 - t0)
876 * c = ((t2 - t3) + (t1 - t0)) / 2
877 */
878 t10 = server->org; /* pkt.xmt == t1 */
879 L_SUB(&t10, &rbufp->recv_time); /* recv_time == t0*/
880
881 t23 = rec; /* pkt.rec == t2 */
882 L_SUB(&t23, &org); /* pkt->org == t3 */
883
884 /* now have (t2 - t3) and (t0 - t1). Calculate (ci) and (di) */
885 /*
886 * Calculate (ci) = ((t1 - t0) / 2) + ((t2 - t3) / 2)
887 * For large offsets this may prevent an overflow on '+'
888 */
889 ci = t10;
890 L_RSHIFT(&ci);
891 tmp = t23;
892 L_RSHIFT(&tmp);
893 L_ADD(&ci, &tmp);
894
895 /*
896 * Calculate di in t23 in full precision, then truncate
897 * to an s_fp.
898 */
899 L_SUB(&t23, &t10);
900 di = LFPTOFP(&t23);
901
902 if (debug > 3)
903 printf("offset: %s, delay %s\n", lfptoa(&ci, 6), fptoa(di, 5));
904
905 di += (FP_SECOND >> (-(int)NTPDATE_PRECISION))
906 + (FP_SECOND >> (-(int)server->precision)) + NTP_MAXSKW;
907
908 if (di <= 0) { /* value still too raunchy to use? */
909 L_CLR(&ci);
910 di = 0;
911 } else {
912 di = max(di, NTP_MINDIST);
913 }
914
915 /*
916 * Shift this data in, then schedule another transmit.
917 */
918 server_data(server, (s_fp) di, &ci, 0);
919
920 if ((int)server->filter_nextpt >= sys_samples) {
921 /*
922 * Got all the data we need. Mark this guy
923 * completed and return.
924 */
925 server->event_time = 0;
926 complete_servers++;
927 return;
928 }
929
930 server->event_time = current_time + sys_timeout;
931}
932
933
934/*
935 * server_data - add a sample to the server's filter registers
936 */
937static void
938server_data(
939 register struct server *server,
940 s_fp d,
941 l_fp *c,
942 u_fp e
943 )
944{
945 u_short i;
946
947 i = server->filter_nextpt;
948 if (i < NTP_SHIFT) {
949 server->filter_delay[i] = d;
950 server->filter_offset[i] = *c;
951 server->filter_soffset[i] = LFPTOFP(c);
952 server->filter_error[i] = e;
953 server->filter_nextpt = (u_short)(i + 1);
954 }
955}
956
957
958/*
959 * clock_filter - determine a server's delay, dispersion and offset
960 */
961static void
962clock_filter(
963 register struct server *server
964 )
965{
966 register int i, j;
967 int ord[NTP_SHIFT];
968
969 INSIST((0 < sys_samples) && (sys_samples <= NTP_SHIFT));
970
971 /*
972 * Sort indices into increasing delay order
973 */
974 for (i = 0; i < sys_samples; i++)
975 ord[i] = i;
976
977 for (i = 0; i < (sys_samples-1); i++) {
978 for (j = i+1; j < sys_samples; j++) {
979 if (server->filter_delay[ord[j]] == 0)
980 continue;
981 if (server->filter_delay[ord[i]] == 0
982 || (server->filter_delay[ord[i]]
983 > server->filter_delay[ord[j]])) {
984 register int tmp;
985
986 tmp = ord[i];
987 ord[i] = ord[j];
988 ord[j] = tmp;
989 }
990 }
991 }
992
993 /*
994 * Now compute the dispersion, and assign values to delay and
995 * offset. If there are no samples in the register, delay and
996 * offset go to zero and dispersion is set to the maximum.
997 */
998 if (server->filter_delay[ord[0]] == 0) {
999 server->delay = 0;
1000 L_CLR(&server->offset);
1001 server->soffset = 0;
1002 server->dispersion = PEER_MAXDISP;
1003 } else {
1004 register s_fp d;
1005
1006 server->delay = server->filter_delay[ord[0]];
1007 server->offset = server->filter_offset[ord[0]];
1008 server->soffset = LFPTOFP(&server->offset);
1009 server->dispersion = 0;
1010 for (i = 1; i < sys_samples; i++) {
1011 if (server->filter_delay[ord[i]] == 0)
1012 d = PEER_MAXDISP;
1013 else {
1014 d = server->filter_soffset[ord[i]]
1015 - server->filter_soffset[ord[0]];
1016 if (d < 0)
1017 d = -d;
1018 if (d > PEER_MAXDISP)
1019 d = PEER_MAXDISP;
1020 }
1021 /*
1022 * XXX This *knows* PEER_FILTER is 1/2
1023 */
1024 server->dispersion += (u_fp)(d) >> i;
1025 }
1026 }
1027 /*
1028 * We're done
1029 */
1030}
1031
1032
1033/*
1034 * clock_select - select the pick-of-the-litter clock from the samples
1035 * we've got.
1036 */
1037static struct server *
1038clock_select(void)
1039{
1040 struct server *server;
1041 u_int nlist;
1042 s_fp d;
1043 u_int count;
1044 u_int i;
1045 u_int j;
1046 u_int k;
1047 int n;
1048 s_fp local_threshold;
1049 struct server *server_list[NTP_MAXCLOCK];
1050 u_fp server_badness[NTP_MAXCLOCK];
1051 struct server *sys_server;
1052
1053 /*
1054 * This first chunk of code is supposed to go through all
1055 * servers we know about to find the NTP_MAXLIST servers which
1056 * are most likely to succeed. We run through the list
1057 * doing the sanity checks and trying to insert anyone who
1058 * looks okay. We are at all times aware that we should
1059 * only keep samples from the top two strata and we only need
1060 * NTP_MAXLIST of them.
1061 */
1062 nlist = 0; /* none yet */
1063 for (server = sys_servers; server != NULL; server = server->next_server) {
1064 if (server->stratum == 0) {
1065 if (debug)
1066 printf("%s: Server dropped: no data\n", ntoa(&server->srcadr));
1067 continue; /* no data */
1068 }
1069 if (server->stratum > NTP_INFIN) {
1070 if (debug)
1071 printf("%s: Server dropped: strata too high\n", ntoa(&server->srcadr));
1072 continue; /* stratum no good */
1073 }
1074 if (server->delay > NTP_MAXWGT) {
1075 if (debug)
1076 printf("%s: Server dropped: server too far away\n",
1077 ntoa(&server->srcadr));
1078 continue; /* too far away */
1079 }
1080 if (server->leap == LEAP_NOTINSYNC) {
1081 if (debug)
1082 printf("%s: Server dropped: leap not in sync\n", ntoa(&server->srcadr));
1083 continue; /* he's in trouble */
1084 }
1085 if (!L_ISHIS(&server->org, &server->reftime)) {
1086 if (debug)
1087 printf("%s: Server dropped: server is very broken\n",
1088 ntoa(&server->srcadr));
1089 continue; /* very broken host */
1090 }
1091 if ((server->org.l_ui - server->reftime.l_ui)
1092 >= NTP_MAXAGE) {
1093 if (debug)
1094 printf("%s: Server dropped: server has gone too long without sync\n",
1095 ntoa(&server->srcadr));
1096 continue; /* too long without sync */
1097 }
1098 if (server->trust != 0) {
1099 if (debug)
1100 printf("%s: Server dropped: Server is untrusted\n",
1101 ntoa(&server->srcadr));
1102 continue;
1103 }
1104
1105 /*
1106 * This one seems sane. Find where he belongs
1107 * on the list.
1108 */
1109 d = server->dispersion + server->dispersion;
1110 for (i = 0; i < nlist; i++)
1111 if (server->stratum <= server_list[i]->stratum)
1112 break;
1113 for ( ; i < nlist; i++) {
1114 if (server->stratum < server_list[i]->stratum)
1115 break;
1116 if (d < (s_fp) server_badness[i])
1117 break;
1118 }
1119
1120 /*
1121 * If i points past the end of the list, this
1122 * guy is a loser, else stick him in.
1123 */
1124 if (i >= NTP_MAXLIST)
1125 continue;
1126 for (j = nlist; j > i; j--)
1127 if (j < NTP_MAXLIST) {
1128 server_list[j] = server_list[j-1];
1129 server_badness[j]
1130 = server_badness[j-1];
1131 }
1132
1133 server_list[i] = server;
1134 server_badness[i] = d;
1135 if (nlist < NTP_MAXLIST)
1136 nlist++;
1137 }
1138
1139 /*
1140 * Got the five-or-less best. Cut the list where the number of
1141 * strata exceeds two.
1142 */
1143 count = 0;
1144 for (i = 1; i < nlist; i++)
1145 if (server_list[i]->stratum > server_list[i-1]->stratum) {
1146 count++;
1147 if (2 == count) {
1148 nlist = i;
1149 break;
1150 }
1151 }
1152
1153 /*
1154 * Whew! What we should have by now is 0 to 5 candidates for
1155 * the job of syncing us. If we have none, we're out of luck.
1156 * If we have one, he's a winner. If we have more, do falseticker
1157 * detection.
1158 */
1159
1160 if (0 == nlist)
1161 sys_server = NULL;
1162 else if (1 == nlist) {
1163 sys_server = server_list[0];
1164 } else {
1165 /*
1166 * Re-sort by stratum, bdelay estimate quality and
1167 * server.delay.
1168 */
1169 for (i = 0; i < nlist-1; i++)
1170 for (j = i+1; j < nlist; j++) {
1171 if (server_list[i]->stratum <
1172 server_list[j]->stratum)
1173 /* already sorted by stratum */
1174 break;
1175 if (server_list[i]->delay <
1176 server_list[j]->delay)
1177 continue;
1178 server = server_list[i];
1179 server_list[i] = server_list[j];
1180 server_list[j] = server;
1181 }
1182
1183 /*
1184 * Calculate the fixed part of the dispersion limit
1185 */
1186 local_threshold = (FP_SECOND >> (-(int)NTPDATE_PRECISION))
1187 + NTP_MAXSKW;
1188
1189 /*
1190 * Now drop samples until we're down to one.
1191 */
1192 while (nlist > 1) {
1193 for (k = 0; k < nlist; k++) {
1194 server_badness[k] = 0;
1195 for (j = 0; j < nlist; j++) {
1196 if (j == k) /* with self? */
1197 continue;
1198 d = server_list[j]->soffset -
1199 server_list[k]->soffset;
1200 if (d < 0) /* abs value */
1201 d = -d;
1202 /*
1203 * XXX This code *knows* that
1204 * NTP_SELECT is 3/4
1205 */
1206 for (i = 0; i < j; i++)
1207 d = (d>>1) + (d>>2);
1208 server_badness[k] += d;
1209 }
1210 }
1211
1212 /*
1213 * We now have an array of nlist badness
1214 * coefficients. Find the badest. Find
1215 * the minimum precision while we're at
1216 * it.
1217 */
1218 i = 0;
1219 n = server_list[0]->precision;;
1220 for (j = 1; j < nlist; j++) {
1221 if (server_badness[j] >= server_badness[i])
1222 i = j;
1223 if (n > server_list[j]->precision)
1224 n = server_list[j]->precision;
1225 }
1226
1227 /*
1228 * i is the index of the server with the worst
1229 * dispersion. If his dispersion is less than
1230 * the threshold, stop now, else delete him and
1231 * continue around again.
1232 */
1233 if ( (s_fp) server_badness[i] < (local_threshold
1234 + (FP_SECOND >> (-n))))
1235 break;
1236 for (j = i + 1; j < nlist; j++)
1237 server_list[j-1] = server_list[j];
1238 nlist--;
1239 }
1240
1241 /*
1242 * What remains is a list of less than 5 servers. Take
1243 * the best.
1244 */
1245 sys_server = server_list[0];
1246 }
1247
1248 /*
1249 * That's it. Return our server.
1250 */
1251 return sys_server;
1252}
1253
1254
1255/*
1256 * clock_adjust - process what we've received, and adjust the time
1257 * if we got anything decent.
1258 */
1259static int
1260clock_adjust(void)
1261{
1262 register struct server *sp, *server;
1263 int dostep;
1264
1265 for (sp = sys_servers; sp != NULL; sp = sp->next_server)
1266 clock_filter(sp);
1267 server = clock_select();
1268
1269 if (debug || simple_query) {
1270 if (debug)
1271 printf ("\n");
1272 for (sp = sys_servers; sp != NULL; sp = sp->next_server)
1273 print_server(sp, stdout);
1274 }
1275
1276 if (server == 0) {
1277 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
1278 "no server suitable for synchronization found");
1279 return(1);
1280 }
1281
1282 if (always_step) {
1283 dostep = 1;
1284 } else if (never_step) {
1285 dostep = 0;
1286 } else {
1287 /* [Bug 3023] get absolute difference, avoiding signed
1288 * integer overflow like hell.
1289 */
1290 u_fp absoffset;
1291 if (server->soffset < 0)
1292 absoffset = 1u + (u_fp)(-(server->soffset + 1));
1293 else
1294 absoffset = (u_fp)server->soffset;
1295 dostep = (absoffset >= NTPDATE_THRESHOLD);
1296 }
1297
1298 if (dostep) {
1299 if (simple_query || l_step_systime(&server->offset)){
1300 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "step time server %s offset %s sec",
1301 stoa(&server->srcadr),
1302 lfptoa(&server->offset, 6));
1303 }
1304 } else {
1305 if (simple_query || l_adj_systime(&server->offset)) {
1306 msyslog(LOG_NOTICE, "adjust time server %s offset %s sec",
1307 stoa(&server->srcadr),
1308 lfptoa(&server->offset, 6));
1309 }
1310 }
1311 return(0);
1312}
1313
1314
1315/*
1316 * is_unreachable - check to see if we have a route to given destination
1317 * (non-blocking).
1318 */
1319static int
1320is_reachable (sockaddr_u *dst)
1321{
1322 SOCKET sockfd;
1323
1324 sockfd = socket(AF(dst), SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
1325 if (sockfd == -1) {
1326 return 0;
1327 }
1328
1329 if (connect(sockfd, &dst->sa, SOCKLEN(dst))) {
1330 closesocket(sockfd);
1331 return 0;
1332 }
1333 closesocket(sockfd);
1334 return 1;
1335}
1336
1337
1338
1339/* XXX ELIMINATE: merge BIG slew into adj_systime in lib/systime.c */
1340/*
1341 * addserver - determine a server's address and allocate a new structure
1342 * for it.
1343 */
1344static void
1345addserver(
1346 char *serv
1347 )
1348{
1349 register struct server *server;
1350 /* Address infos structure to store result of getaddrinfo */
1351 struct addrinfo *addrResult, *ptr;
1352 /* Address infos structure to store hints for getaddrinfo */
1353 struct addrinfo hints;
1354 /* Error variable for getaddrinfo */
1355 int error;
1356 /* Service name */
1357 char service[5];
1358 sockaddr_u addr;
1359
1360 strlcpy(service, "ntp", sizeof(service));
1361
1362 /* Get host address. Looking for UDP datagram connection. */
1363 ZERO(hints);
1364 hints.ai_family = ai_fam_templ;
1365 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
1366
1367#ifdef DEBUG
1368 if (debug)
1369 printf("Looking for host %s and service %s\n", serv, service);
1370#endif
1371
1372 error = getaddrinfo(serv, service, &hints, &addrResult);
1373 if (error != 0) {
1374 /* Conduct more refined error analysis */
1375 if (error == EAI_FAIL || error == EAI_AGAIN){
1376 /* Name server is unusable. Exit after failing on the
1377 first server, in order to shorten the timeout caused
1378 by waiting for resolution of several servers */
1379 fprintf(stderr, "Exiting, name server cannot be used: %s (%d)",
1380 gai_strerror(error), error);
1381 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "name server cannot be used: %s (%d)",
1382 gai_strerror(error), error);
1383 exit(1);
1384 }
1385 fprintf(stderr, "Error resolving %s: %s (%d)\n", serv,
1386 gai_strerror(error), error);
1387 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "Can't find host %s: %s (%d)", serv,
1388 gai_strerror(error), error);
1389 return;
1390 }
1391#ifdef DEBUG
1392 if (debug) {
1393 ZERO(addr);
1394 INSIST(addrResult->ai_addrlen <= sizeof(addr));
1395 memcpy(&addr, addrResult->ai_addr, addrResult->ai_addrlen);
1396 fprintf(stderr, "host found : %s\n", stohost(&addr));
1397 }
1398#endif
1399
1400 /* We must get all returned server in case the first one fails */
1401 for (ptr = addrResult; ptr != NULL; ptr = ptr->ai_next) {
1402 ZERO(addr);
1403 INSIST(ptr->ai_addrlen <= sizeof(addr));
1404 memcpy(&addr, ptr->ai_addr, ptr->ai_addrlen);
1405 if (is_reachable(&addr)) {
1406 server = emalloc_zero(sizeof(*server));
1407 memcpy(&server->srcadr, ptr->ai_addr, ptr->ai_addrlen);
1408 server->event_time = ++sys_numservers;
1409 if (sys_servers == NULL)
1410 sys_servers = server;
1411 else {
1412 struct server *sp;
1413
1414 for (sp = sys_servers; sp->next_server != NULL;
1415 sp = sp->next_server)
1416 /* empty */;
1417 sp->next_server = server;
1418 }
1419 }
1420 }
1421
1422 freeaddrinfo(addrResult);
1423}
1424
1425
1426/*
1427 * findserver - find a server in the list given its address
1428 * ***(For now it isn't totally AF-Independant, to check later..)
1429 */
1430static struct server *
1431findserver(
1432 sockaddr_u *addr
1433 )
1434{
1435 struct server *server;
1436 struct server *mc_server;
1437
1438 mc_server = NULL;
1439 if (SRCPORT(addr) != NTP_PORT)
1440 return 0;
1441
1442 for (server = sys_servers; server != NULL;
1443 server = server->next_server) {
1444 if (SOCK_EQ(addr, &server->srcadr))
1445 return server;
1446
1447 if (AF(addr) == AF(&server->srcadr)) {
1448 if (IS_MCAST(&server->srcadr))
1449 mc_server = server;
1450 }
1451 }
1452
1453 if (mc_server != NULL) {
1454
1455 struct server *sp;
1456
1457 if (mc_server->event_time != 0) {
1458 mc_server->event_time = 0;
1459 complete_servers++;
1460 }
1461
1462 server = emalloc_zero(sizeof(*server));
1463
1464 server->srcadr = *addr;
1465
1466 server->event_time = ++sys_numservers;
1467
1468 for (sp = sys_servers; sp->next_server != NULL;
1469 sp = sp->next_server)
1470 /* empty */;
1471 sp->next_server = server;
1472 transmit(server);
1473 }
1474 return NULL;
1475}
1476
1477
1478/*
1479 * timer - process a timer interrupt
1480 */
1481void
1482timer(void)
1483{
1484 struct server *server;
1485
1486 /*
1487 * Bump the current idea of the time
1488 */
1489 current_time++;
1490
1491 /*
1492 * Search through the server list looking for guys
1493 * who's event timers have expired. Give these to
1494 * the transmit routine.
1495 */
1496 for (server = sys_servers; server != NULL;
1497 server = server->next_server) {
1498 if (server->event_time != 0
1499 && server->event_time <= current_time)
1500 transmit(server);
1501 }
1502}
1503
1504
1505/*
1506 * The code duplication in the following subroutine sucks, but
1507 * we need to appease ansi2knr.
1508 */
1509
1510#ifndef SYS_WINNT
1511/*
1512 * alarming - record the occurance of an alarm interrupt
1513 */
1514static RETSIGTYPE
1515alarming(
1516 int sig
1517 )
1518{
1519 alarm_flag++;
1520}
1521#else /* SYS_WINNT follows */
1522void CALLBACK
1523alarming(UINT uTimerID, UINT uMsg, DWORD dwUser, DWORD dw1, DWORD dw2)
1524{
1525 UNUSED_ARG(uTimerID); UNUSED_ARG(uMsg); UNUSED_ARG(dwUser);
1526 UNUSED_ARG(dw1); UNUSED_ARG(dw2);
1527
1528 alarm_flag++;
1529}
1530
1531static void
1532callTimeEndPeriod(void)
1533{
1534 timeEndPeriod( wTimerRes );
1535 wTimerRes = 0;
1536}
1537#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
1538
1539
1540/*
1541 * init_alarm - set up the timer interrupt
1542 */
1543static void
1544init_alarm(void)
1545{
1546#ifndef SYS_WINNT
1547# ifdef HAVE_TIMER_CREATE
1548 struct itimerspec its;
1549# else
1550 struct itimerval itv;
1551# endif
1552#else /* SYS_WINNT follows */
1553 TIMECAPS tc;
1554 UINT wTimerID;
1555 HANDLE hToken;
1556 TOKEN_PRIVILEGES tkp;
1557 DWORD dwUser = 0;
1558#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
1559
1560 alarm_flag = 0;
1561
1562#ifndef SYS_WINNT
1563# ifdef HAVE_TIMER_CREATE
1564 alarm_flag = 0;
1565 /* this code was put in as setitimer() is non existant this us the
1566 * POSIX "equivalents" setup - casey
1567 */
1568 /* ntpdate_timerid is global - so we can kill timer later */
1569 if (timer_create (CLOCK_REALTIME, NULL, &ntpdate_timerid) ==
1570# ifdef SYS_VXWORKS
1571 ERROR
1572# else
1573 -1
1574# endif
1575 )
1576 {
1577 fprintf (stderr, "init_alarm(): timer_create (...) FAILED\n");
1578 return;
1579 }
1580
1581 /* TIMER_HZ = (5)
1582 * Set up the alarm interrupt. The first comes 1/(2*TIMER_HZ)
1583 * seconds from now and they continue on every 1/TIMER_HZ seconds.
1584 */
1585 signal_no_reset(SIGALRM, alarming);
1586 its.it_interval.tv_sec = 0;
1587 its.it_value.tv_sec = 0;
1588 its.it_interval.tv_nsec = 1000000000/TIMER_HZ;
1589 its.it_value.tv_nsec = 1000000000/(TIMER_HZ<<1);
1590 timer_settime(ntpdate_timerid, 0 /* !TIMER_ABSTIME */, &its, NULL);
1591# else /* !HAVE_TIMER_CREATE follows */
1592 /*
1593 * Set up the alarm interrupt. The first comes 1/(2*TIMER_HZ)
1594 * seconds from now and they continue on every 1/TIMER_HZ seconds.
1595 */
1596 signal_no_reset(SIGALRM, alarming);
1597 itv.it_interval.tv_sec = 0;
1598 itv.it_value.tv_sec = 0;
1599 itv.it_interval.tv_usec = 1000000/TIMER_HZ;
1600 itv.it_value.tv_usec = 1000000/(TIMER_HZ<<1);
1601
1602 setitimer(ITIMER_REAL, &itv, NULL);
1603# endif /* !HAVE_TIMER_CREATE */
1604#else /* SYS_WINNT follows */
1605 _tzset();
1606
1607 if (!simple_query && !debug) {
1608 /*
1609 * Get privileges needed for fiddling with the clock
1610 */
1611
1612 /* get the current process token handle */
1613 if (!OpenProcessToken(GetCurrentProcess(), TOKEN_ADJUST_PRIVILEGES | TOKEN_QUERY, &hToken)) {
1614 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "OpenProcessToken failed: %m");
1615 exit(1);
1616 }
1617 /* get the LUID for system-time privilege. */
1618 LookupPrivilegeValue(NULL, SE_SYSTEMTIME_NAME, &tkp.Privileges[0].Luid);
1619 tkp.PrivilegeCount = 1; /* one privilege to set */
1620 tkp.Privileges[0].Attributes = SE_PRIVILEGE_ENABLED;
1621 /* get set-time privilege for this process. */
1622 AdjustTokenPrivileges(hToken, FALSE, &tkp, 0,(PTOKEN_PRIVILEGES) NULL, 0);
1623 /* cannot test return value of AdjustTokenPrivileges. */
1624 if (GetLastError() != ERROR_SUCCESS)
1625 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "AdjustTokenPrivileges failed: %m");
1626 }
1627
1628 /*
1629 * Set up timer interrupts for every 2**EVENT_TIMEOUT seconds
1630 * Under Win/NT, expiry of timer interval leads to invocation
1631 * of a callback function (on a different thread) rather than
1632 * generating an alarm signal
1633 */
1634
1635 /* determine max and min resolution supported */
1636 if(timeGetDevCaps(&tc, sizeof(TIMECAPS)) != TIMERR_NOERROR) {
1637 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "timeGetDevCaps failed: %m");
1638 exit(1);
1639 }
1640 wTimerRes = min(max(tc.wPeriodMin, TARGET_RESOLUTION), tc.wPeriodMax);
1641 /* establish the minimum timer resolution that we'll use */
1642 timeBeginPeriod(wTimerRes);
1643 atexit(callTimeEndPeriod);
1644
1645 /* start the timer event */
1646 wTimerID = timeSetEvent(
1647 (UINT) (1000/TIMER_HZ), /* Delay */
1648 wTimerRes, /* Resolution */
1649 (LPTIMECALLBACK) alarming, /* Callback function */
1650 (DWORD) dwUser, /* User data */
1651 TIME_PERIODIC); /* Event type (periodic) */
1652 if (wTimerID == 0) {
1653 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "timeSetEvent failed: %m");
1654 exit(1);
1655 }
1656#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
1657}
1658
1659
1660
1661
1662/*
1663 * We do asynchronous input using the SIGIO facility. A number of
1664 * recvbuf buffers are preallocated for input. In the signal
1665 * handler we poll to see if the socket is ready and read the
1666 * packets from it into the recvbuf's along with a time stamp and
1667 * an indication of the source host and the interface it was received
1668 * through. This allows us to get as accurate receive time stamps
1669 * as possible independent of other processing going on.
1670 *
1671 * We allocate a number of recvbufs equal to the number of servers
1672 * plus 2. This should be plenty.
1673 */
1674
1675
1676/*
1677 * init_io - initialize I/O data and open socket
1678 */
1679static void
1680init_io(void)
1681{
1682 struct addrinfo *res, *ressave;
1683 struct addrinfo hints;
1684 sockaddr_u addr;
1685 char service[5];
1686 int rc;
1687 int optval = 1;
1688 int check_ntp_port_in_use = !debug && !simple_query && !unpriv_port;
1689
1690 /*
1691 * Init buffer free list and stat counters
1692 */
1693 init_recvbuff(sys_numservers + 2);
1694
1695 /*
1696 * Open the socket
1697 */
1698
1699 strlcpy(service, "ntp", sizeof(service));
1700
1701 /*
1702 * Init hints addrinfo structure
1703 */
1704 ZERO(hints);
1705 hints.ai_family = ai_fam_templ;
1706 hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE;
1707 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
1708
1709 if (getaddrinfo(NULL, service, &hints, &res) != 0) {
1710 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "getaddrinfo() failed: %m");
1711 exit(1);
1712 /*NOTREACHED*/
1713 }
1714
1715#ifdef SYS_WINNT
1716 if (check_ntp_port_in_use && ntp_port_inuse(AF_INET, NTP_PORT)){
1717 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "the NTP socket is in use, exiting: %m");
1718 exit(1);
1719 }
1720#endif
1721
1722 /* Remember the address of the addrinfo structure chain */
1723 ressave = res;
1724
1725 /*
1726 * For each structure returned, open and bind socket
1727 */
1728 for(nbsock = 0; (nbsock < MAX_AF) && res ; res = res->ai_next) {
1729 /* create a datagram (UDP) socket */
1730 fd[nbsock] = socket(res->ai_family, res->ai_socktype, res->ai_protocol);
1731 if (fd[nbsock] == SOCKET_ERROR) {
1732#ifndef SYS_WINNT
1733 if (errno == EPROTONOSUPPORT || errno == EAFNOSUPPORT ||
1734 errno == EPFNOSUPPORT)
1735#else
1736 int err = WSAGetLastError();
1737 if (err == WSAEPROTONOSUPPORT || err == WSAEAFNOSUPPORT ||
1738 err == WSAEPFNOSUPPORT)
1739#endif
1740 continue;
1741 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "socket() failed: %m");
1742 exit(1);
1743 /*NOTREACHED*/
1744 }
1745 /* set socket to reuse address */
1746 if (setsockopt(fd[nbsock], SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (void*) &optval, sizeof(optval)) < 0) {
1747 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "setsockopt() SO_REUSEADDR failed: %m");
1748 exit(1);
1749 /*NOTREACHED*/
1750 }
1751#ifdef IPV6_V6ONLY
1752 /* Restricts AF_INET6 socket to IPv6 communications (see RFC 2553bis-03) */
1753 if (res->ai_family == AF_INET6)
1754 if (setsockopt(fd[nbsock], IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_V6ONLY, (void*) &optval, sizeof(optval)) < 0) {
1755 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "setsockopt() IPV6_V6ONLY failed: %m");
1756 exit(1);
1757 /*NOTREACHED*/
1758 }
1759#endif
1760
1761 /* Remember the socket family in fd_family structure */
1762 fd_family[nbsock] = res->ai_family;
1763
1764 /*
1765 * bind the socket to the NTP port
1766 */
1767 if (check_ntp_port_in_use) {
1768 ZERO(addr);
1769 INSIST(res->ai_addrlen <= sizeof(addr));
1770 memcpy(&addr, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen);
1771 rc = bind(fd[nbsock], &addr.sa, SOCKLEN(&addr));
1772 if (rc < 0) {
1773 if (EADDRINUSE == socket_errno())
1774 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "the NTP socket is in use, exiting");
1775 else
1776 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "bind() fails: %m");
1777 exit(1);
1778 }
1779 }
1780
1781#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
1782 fdmask[nbsock].fd = fd[nbsock];
1783 fdmask[nbsock].events = POLLIN;
1784#else
1785 FD_SET(fd[nbsock], &fdmask);
1786 if (maxfd < fd[nbsock]+1) {
1787 maxfd = fd[nbsock]+1;
1788 }
1789#endif
1790
1791 /*
1792 * set non-blocking,
1793 */
1794#ifndef SYS_WINNT
1795# ifdef SYS_VXWORKS
1796 {
1797 int on = TRUE;
1798
1799 if (ioctl(fd[nbsock],FIONBIO, &on) == ERROR) {
1800 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "ioctl(FIONBIO) fails: %m");
1801 exit(1);
1802 }
1803 }
1804# else /* not SYS_VXWORKS */
1805# if defined(O_NONBLOCK)
1806 if (fcntl(fd[nbsock], F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK) < 0) {
1807 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "fcntl(FNDELAY|FASYNC) fails: %m");
1808 exit(1);
1809 /*NOTREACHED*/
1810 }
1811# else /* not O_NONBLOCK */
1812# if defined(FNDELAY)
1813 if (fcntl(fd[nbsock], F_SETFL, FNDELAY) < 0) {
1814 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "fcntl(FNDELAY|FASYNC) fails: %m");
1815 exit(1);
1816 /*NOTREACHED*/
1817 }
1818# else /* FNDELAY */
1819# include "Bletch: Need non blocking I/O"
1820# endif /* FNDELAY */
1821# endif /* not O_NONBLOCK */
1822# endif /* SYS_VXWORKS */
1823#else /* SYS_WINNT */
1824 if (ioctlsocket(fd[nbsock], FIONBIO, (u_long *) &on) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
1825 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "ioctlsocket(FIONBIO) fails: %m");
1826 exit(1);
1827 }
1828#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
1829 nbsock++;
1830 }
1831 freeaddrinfo(ressave);
1832}
1833
1834/*
1835 * sendpkt - send a packet to the specified destination
1836 */
1837static void
1838sendpkt(
1839 sockaddr_u *dest,
1840 struct pkt *pkt,
1841 int len
1842 )
1843{
1844 int i;
1845 int cc;
1846 SOCKET sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
1847
1848#ifdef SYS_WINNT
1849 DWORD err;
1850#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
1851
1852 /* Find a local family compatible socket to send ntp packet to ntp server */
1853 for(i = 0; (i < MAX_AF); i++) {
1854 if(AF(dest) == fd_family[i]) {
1855 sock = fd[i];
1856 break;
1857 }
1858 }
1859
1860 if (INVALID_SOCKET == sock) {
1861 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "cannot find family compatible socket to send ntp packet");
1862 exit(1);
1863 /*NOTREACHED*/
1864 }
1865
1866 cc = sendto(sock, (char *)pkt, len, 0, (struct sockaddr *)dest,
1867 SOCKLEN(dest));
1868
1869 if (SOCKET_ERROR == cc) {
1870#ifndef SYS_WINNT
1871 if (errno != EWOULDBLOCK && errno != ENOBUFS)
1872#else
1873 err = WSAGetLastError();
1874 if (err != WSAEWOULDBLOCK && err != WSAENOBUFS)
1875#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
1876 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "sendto(%s): %m", stohost(dest));
1877 }
1878}
1879
1880
1881/*
1882 * input_handler - receive packets asynchronously
1883 */
1884void
1885input_handler(void)
1886{
1887 register int n;
1888 register struct recvbuf *rb;
1889 struct sock_timeval tvzero;
1890 GETSOCKNAME_SOCKLEN_TYPE fromlen;
1891 l_fp ts;
1892 int i;
1893#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
1894 struct pollfd fds[MAX_AF];
1895#else
1896 fd_set fds;
1897#endif
1898 SOCKET fdc = 0;
1899
1900 /*
1901 * Do a poll to see if we have data
1902 */
1903 for (;;) {
1904 tvzero.tv_sec = tvzero.tv_usec = 0;
1905#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
1906 memcpy(fds, fdmask, sizeof(fdmask));
1907 n = poll(fds, (unsigned int)nbsock, tvzero.tv_sec * 1000);
1908
1909 /*
1910 * Determine which socket received data
1911 */
1912
1913 for(i=0; i < nbsock; i++) {
1914 if(fds[i].revents & POLLIN) {
1915 fdc = fd[i];
1916 break;
1917 }
1918 }
1919
1920#else
1921 fds = fdmask;
1922 n = select(maxfd, &fds, NULL, NULL, &tvzero);
1923
1924 /*
1925 * Determine which socket received data
1926 */
1927
1928 for(i=0; i < nbsock; i++) {
1929 if(FD_ISSET(fd[i], &fds)) {
1930 fdc = fd[i];
1931 break;
1932 }
1933 }
1934
1935#endif
1936
1937 /*
1938 * If nothing to do, just return. If an error occurred,
1939 * complain and return. If we've got some, freeze a
1940 * timestamp.
1941 */
1942 if (n == 0)
1943 return;
1944 else if (n == -1) {
1945 if (errno != EINTR)
1946 msyslog(LOG_ERR,
1947#ifdef HAVE_POLL_H
1948 "poll() error: %m"
1949#else
1950 "select() error: %m"
1951#endif
1952 );
1953 return;
1954 }
1955 get_systime(&ts);
1956
1957 /*
1958 * Get a buffer and read the frame. If we
1959 * haven't got a buffer, or this is received
1960 * on the wild card socket, just dump the packet.
1961 */
1962 if (initializing || free_recvbuffs() == 0) {
1963 char buf[100];
1964
1965
1966#ifndef SYS_WINNT
1967 (void) read(fdc, buf, sizeof buf);
1968#else
1969 /* NT's _read does not operate on nonblocking sockets
1970 * either recvfrom or ReadFile() has to be used here.
1971 * ReadFile is used in [ntpd]ntp_intres() and ntpdc,
1972 * just to be different use recvfrom() here
1973 */
1974 recvfrom(fdc, buf, sizeof(buf), 0, (struct sockaddr *)0, NULL);
1975#endif /* SYS_WINNT */
1976 continue;
1977 }
1978
1979 rb = get_free_recv_buffer();
1980
1981 fromlen = sizeof(rb->recv_srcadr);
1982 rb->recv_length = recvfrom(fdc, (char *)&rb->recv_pkt,
1983 sizeof(rb->recv_pkt), 0,
1984 (struct sockaddr *)&rb->recv_srcadr, &fromlen);
1985 if (rb->recv_length == -1) {
1986 freerecvbuf(rb);
1987 continue;
1988 }
1989
1990 /*
1991 * Got one. Mark how and when it got here,
1992 * put it on the full list.
1993 */
1994 rb->recv_time = ts;
1995 add_full_recv_buffer(rb);
1996 }
1997}
1998
1999
2000/*
2001 * adj_systime - do a big long slew of the system time
2002 */
2003static int
2004l_adj_systime(
2005 l_fp *ts
2006 )
2007{
2008 struct timeval adjtv, oadjtv;
2009 int isneg = 0;
2010 l_fp offset;
2011#ifndef STEP_SLEW
2012 l_fp overshoot;
2013#endif
2014
2015 /*
2016 * Take the absolute value of the offset
2017 */
2018 offset = *ts;
2019 if (L_ISNEG(&offset)) {
2020 isneg = 1;
2021 L_NEG(&offset);
2022 }
2023
2024#ifndef STEP_SLEW
2025 /*
2026 * Calculate the overshoot. XXX N.B. This code *knows*
2027 * ADJ_OVERSHOOT is 1/2.
2028 */
2029 overshoot = offset;
2030 L_RSHIFTU(&overshoot);
2031 if (overshoot.l_ui != 0 || (overshoot.l_uf > ADJ_MAXOVERSHOOT)) {
2032 overshoot.l_ui = 0;
2033 overshoot.l_uf = ADJ_MAXOVERSHOOT;
2034 }
2035 L_ADD(&offset, &overshoot);
2036#endif
2037 TSTOTV(&offset, &adjtv);
2038
2039 if (isneg) {
2040 adjtv.tv_sec = -adjtv.tv_sec;
2041 adjtv.tv_usec = -adjtv.tv_usec;
2042 }
2043
2044 if (!debug && (adjtv.tv_usec != 0)) {
2045 /* A time correction needs to be applied. */
2046#if !defined SYS_WINNT && !defined SYS_CYGWIN32
2047 /* Slew the time on systems that support this. */
2048 if (adjtime(&adjtv, &oadjtv) < 0) {
2049 msyslog(LOG_ERR, "Can't adjust the time of day: %m");
2050 exit(1);
2051 }
2052#else /* SYS_WINNT or SYS_CYGWIN32 is defined */
2053 /*
2054 * The NT SetSystemTimeAdjustment() call achieves slewing by
2055 * changing the clock frequency. This means that we cannot specify
2056 * it to slew the clock by a definite amount and then stop like
2057 * the Unix adjtime() routine. We can technically adjust the clock
2058 * frequency, have ntpdate sleep for a while, and then wake
2059 * up and reset the clock frequency, but this might cause some
2060 * grief if the user attempts to run ntpd immediately after
2061 * ntpdate and the socket is in use.
2062 */
2063 printf("\nSlewing the system time is not supported on Windows. Use the -b option to step the time.\n");
2064#endif /* defined SYS_WINNT || defined SYS_CYGWIN32 */
2065 }
2066 return 1;
2067}
2068
2069
2070/*
2071 * This fuction is not the same as lib/systime step_systime!!!
2072 */
2073static int
2074l_step_systime(
2075 l_fp *ts
2076 )
2077{
2078 double dtemp;
2079
2080#ifdef SLEWALWAYS
2081#ifdef STEP_SLEW
2082 l_fp ftmp;
2083 int isneg;
2084 int n;
2085
2086 if (debug)
2087 return 1;
2088
2089 /*
2090 * Take the absolute value of the offset
2091 */
2092 ftmp = *ts;
2093
2094 if (L_ISNEG(&ftmp)) {
2095 L_NEG(&ftmp);
2096 isneg = 1;
2097 } else
2098 isneg = 0;
2099
2100 if (ftmp.l_ui >= 3) { /* Step it and slew - we might win */
2101 LFPTOD(ts, dtemp);
2102 n = step_systime(dtemp);
2103 if (n == 0)
2104 return 0;
2105 if (isneg) /* WTF! */
2106 ts->l_ui = ~0;
2107 else
2108 ts->l_ui = ~0;
2109 }
2110 /*
2111 * Just add adjustment into the current offset. The update
2112 * routine will take care of bringing the system clock into
2113 * line.
2114 */
2115#endif
2116 if (debug)
2117 return 1;
2118#ifdef FORCE_NTPDATE_STEP
2119 LFPTOD(ts, dtemp);
2120 return step_systime(dtemp);
2121#else
2122 l_adj_systime(ts);
2123 return 1;
2124#endif
2125#else /* SLEWALWAYS */
2126 if (debug)
2127 return 1;
2128 LFPTOD(ts, dtemp);
2129 return step_systime(dtemp);
2130#endif /* SLEWALWAYS */
2131}

2133
2134/* XXX ELIMINATE print_server similar in ntptrace.c, ntpdate.c */
2135/*
2136 * print_server - print detail information for a server
2137 */
2138static void
2139print_server(
2140 register struct server *pp,
2141 FILE *fp
2142 )
2143{
2144 register int i;
2145 char junk[5];
2146 const char *str;
2147
2148 if (pp->stratum == 0) /* Nothing received => nothing to print */
2149 return;
2150
2151 if (!debug) {
2152 (void) fprintf(fp, "server %s, stratum %d, offset %s, delay %s\n",
2153 stoa(&pp->srcadr), pp->stratum,
2154 lfptoa(&pp->offset, 6), fptoa((s_fp)pp->delay, 5));
2155 return;
2156 }
2157
2158 (void) fprintf(fp, "server %s, port %d\n",
2159 stoa(&pp->srcadr), ntohs(((struct sockaddr_in*)&(pp->srcadr))->sin_port));
2160
2161 (void) fprintf(fp, "stratum %d, precision %d, leap %c%c, trust %03o\n",
2162 pp->stratum, pp->precision,
2163 pp->leap & 0x2 ? '1' : '0',
2164 pp->leap & 0x1 ? '1' : '0',
2165 pp->trust);
2166
2167 if (REFID_ISTEXT(pp->stratum)) {
2168 str = (char *) &pp->refid;
2169 for (i=0; i<4 && str[i]; i++) {
2170 junk[i] = (isprint((unsigned char)str[i]) ? str[i] : '.');
2171 }
2172 junk[i] = 0; // force terminating 0
2173 str = junk;
2174 } else {
2175 str = numtoa(pp->refid);
2176 }
2177 (void) fprintf(fp,
2178 "refid [%s], root delay %s, root dispersion %s\n",
2179 str, fptoa((s_fp)pp->rootdelay, 6),
2180 ufptoa(pp->rootdisp, 6));
2181
2182 (void) fprintf(fp, "transmitted %d, in filter %d\n",
2183 pp->xmtcnt, pp->filter_nextpt);
2184
2185 (void) fprintf(fp, "reference time: %s\n",
2186 prettydate(&pp->reftime));
2187 (void) fprintf(fp, "originate timestamp: %s\n",
2188 prettydate(&pp->org));
2189 (void) fprintf(fp, "transmit timestamp: %s\n",
2190 prettydate(&pp->xmt));
2191
2192 if (sys_samples > 1) {
2193 (void) fprintf(fp, "filter delay: ");
2194 for (i = 0; i < NTP_SHIFT; i++) {
2195 (void) fprintf(fp, " %-8.8s", fptoa(pp->filter_delay[i], 5));
2196 if (i == (NTP_SHIFT>>1)-1)
2197 (void) fprintf(fp, "\n ");
2198 }
2199 (void) fprintf(fp, "\n");
2200
2201 (void) fprintf(fp, "filter offset:");
2202 for (i = 0; i < PEER_SHIFT; i++) {
2203 (void) fprintf(fp, " %-8.8s", lfptoa(&pp->filter_offset[i], 6));
2204 if (i == (PEER_SHIFT>>1)-1)
2205 (void) fprintf(fp, "\n ");
2206 }
2207 (void) fprintf(fp, "\n");
2208 }
2209
2210 (void) fprintf(fp, "delay %s, dispersion %s\n",
2211 fptoa((s_fp)pp->delay, 5), ufptoa(pp->dispersion, 5));
2212
2213 (void) fprintf(fp, "offset %s\n\n",
2214 lfptoa(&pp->offset, 6));
2215}

2217
2218#ifdef HAVE_NETINFO
2219static ni_namelist *
2220getnetinfoservers(void)
2221{
2222 ni_status status;
2223 void *domain;
2224 ni_id confdir;
2225 ni_namelist *namelist = emalloc(sizeof(ni_namelist));
2226
2227 /* Find a time server in NetInfo */
2228 if ((status = ni_open(NULL, ".", &domain)) != NI_OK) return NULL;
2229
2230 while (status = ni_pathsearch(domain, &confdir, NETINFO_CONFIG_DIR) == NI_NODIR) {
2231 void *next_domain;
2232 if (ni_open(domain, "..", &next_domain) != NI_OK) break;
2233 ni_free(domain);
2234 domain = next_domain;
2235 }
2236 if (status != NI_OK) return NULL;
2237
2238 NI_INIT(namelist);
2239 if (ni_lookupprop(domain, &confdir, "server", namelist) != NI_OK) {
2240 ni_namelist_free(namelist);
2241 free(namelist);
2242 return NULL;
2243 }
2244
2245 return(namelist);
2246}
2247#endif
2248
2249#ifdef SYS_WINNT
2250isc_boolean_t ntp_port_inuse(int af, u_short port)
2251{
2252 /*
2253 * Check if NTP socket is already in use on this system
2254 * This is only for Windows Systems, as they tend not to fail on the real bind() below
2255 */
2256
2257 SOCKET checksocket;
2258 struct sockaddr_in checkservice;
2259 checksocket = socket(af, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
2260 if (checksocket == INVALID_SOCKET) {
2261 return (ISC_TRUE);
2262 }
2263
2264 checkservice.sin_family = (short) AF_INET;
2265 checkservice.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_LOOPBACK;
2266 checkservice.sin_port = htons(port);
2267
2268 if (bind(checksocket, (struct sockaddr *)&checkservice,
2269 sizeof(checkservice)) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
2270 if ( WSAGetLastError() == WSAEADDRINUSE ){
2271 closesocket(checksocket);
2272 return (ISC_TRUE);
2273 }
2274 }
2275 closesocket(checksocket);
2276 return (ISC_FALSE);
2277}
2278#endif
